IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO SHARE THE TRANSFORMATIVE POWER OF MUSIC THROUGH TEACHING, PERFORMING & GIVING MUSIC
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION IS TO SHARE THE TRANSFORMATIVE POWER OF MUSIC THROUGH TEACHING, PERFORMING AND GIVING MUSIC GENEROUSLY WHEN THERE IS NEED.
IRS990.Desc: THE MUSIC EDUCATION PROGRAM SERVED APPROXIMATELY 1,200 STUDENTS OF ALL AGES AND ABILITIES WITH A FACULTY OF PROFESSIONAL ARTISTS AND EDUCATORS THROUGH PRIVATE INSTRUCTION, GROUP LESSONS AND ENSEMBLES FOR ALL INSTRUMENTS AND VOICE, IN MANY GENRES INCLUDING CLASSICAL, JAZZ, FOLK, POPULAR, CELTIC, AND TRADITIONAL MUSIC. THE ORGANIZATION IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING AFFORDABLE MUSIC EDUCATION AND ALSO HAS BEEN ABLE TO PROVIDE $54,597 IN SCHOLARSHIP AID.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION IS CENTERED ON THE PRINCIPLE THAT PERFORMANCE AND EDUCATION ARE FULLY INTEGRATED AND REPRESENT AN INTEGRAL PART OF THE ORGANIZATION'S MUSIC EDUCATION CURRICULUM. ATTENDING PROFESSIONAL CONCERTS AND WATCHING A PROFESSIONAL AT WORK IS ESSENTIAL TO DEVELOPING STRONG PERFORMANCE TECHNIQUES AND AN UNDERSTANDING OF HOW TO MASTER ONE'S INSTRUMENT. LISTENING TO, AND EVALUATING, MUSIC AND MUSIC PERFORMANCE ARE KEY STANDARDS OF A COMPREHENSIVE, QUALITY MUSIC EDUCATION PROGRAM. THE ORGANIZATION'S PERFORMANCE PROGRAM SERVED APPROXIMATELY 4,800 PEOPLE THROUGH PERFORMANCES BY HIGH QUALITY GUEST ARTISTS IN MANY GENRES OF MUSIC AS WELL AS THE ORGANIZATION'S PROFESSIONAL ORCHESTRA LED BY ARTISTIC DIRECTOR, BRUCE HANGEN.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: THE ORGANIZATION'S MUSIC PHILANTHROPY PROGRAM SERVED APPROXIMATELY 1,100 PEOPLE THROUGH FREE AFTER SCHOOL MUSIC LESSONS AND PROGRAMS IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, FREE MONTHLY PROFESSIONAL CONCERTS THAT SERVE SENIOR CITIZENS, AND SINGING BY ITS THRESHOLD SINGERS FOR THOSE IN HOSPICE CARE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S RETURN ON INVESTMENT OF ENDOWMENT FUNDS IS USED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS, PHILANTHROPIC OUTREACH, ORCHESTRA INITIATIVES, EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS AND OPERATIONAL NEEDS.

MANAGEMENT HAS EVALUATED SIGNIFICANT TAX POSITIONS AGAINST THE CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY PROFESSIONAL STANDARDS AND BELIEVES THERE ARE NO SUCH TAX POSITIONS REQUIRING ACCOUNTING RECOGNITION IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. MANAGEMENT DOES NOT BELIEVE ITS EVALUATION OF TAX POSITIONS WILL SIGNIFICANTLY CHANGE WITHIN TWELVE MONTHS OF JUNE 30, 2022. ANY CHANGES IN TAX POSITIONS WILL BE RECORDED WHEN THE ULTIMATE OUTCOME BECOMES KNOWN. THE ORGANIZATION'S INCOME TAX RETURNS ARE SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES GENERALLY FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2019, 2020 AND 2021. ACCRUED INTEREST AND PENALTIES ASSOCIATED WITH UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS ARE RECOGNIZED AS A PART OF INTEREST EXPENSE AND MISCELLANEOUS EXPENSES, RESPECTIVELY, IN THE ACCOMPANYING STATEMENT OF ACTIVITIES. THE ORGANIZATION HAS NO ACCRUED INTEREST AND PENALTIES ASSOCIATED WITH UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AT JUNE 30, 2022 AND NONE WERE INCURRED DURING THE YEAR THEN ENDED.
SCHOLARSHIPS GRANTED -54,597. CHANGE IN VALUE OF CHARITABLE GIFT ANNUITIES -21,603.
THE ORGANIZATION'S NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY IS INCLUDED ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE AND REGISTRATION DOCUMENTATION.
THE ORGANIZATION RECEIVED $35,600 FROM THE MASSACHUSETTS CULTURAL COUNCIL, $16,000 FROM THE CITY OF LAWRENCE, AND $9,500 FROM VARIOUS LOCAL CULTURAL COUNCILS.

THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS IN NEED BASED UPON THE AVAILABLE FINANCIAL RESOURCES OF THE ORGANIZATION AND AN APPLICATION AND SELECTION PROCESS USING DEFINED CRITERIA. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS GRANTED ARE TRACKED INTERNALLY AND APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE COST OF TUITION FOR CLASSES AND LESSONS TO BE TAKEN AT OUR ORGANIZATION. THE ORGANIZATION TRACKS EACH STUDENT AND EACH LESSON OR CLASS THEY ATTEND.
SCHEDULE M, PART I, LINE 9: THE NUMBER IN COLUMN B REPRESENTS THE TOTAL NUMBER OF OCCASIONS SECURITIES WERE DONATED.

THE ORGANIZATION CALCULATES CONTRIBUTION AMOUNTS FOR SECURITIES ON THE DATE SECURITIES ARE RECEIVED. THE ORGANIZATION MULTIPLIES THE AVERAGE OF THE HIGH AND LOW STOCK PRICES ON THE DATE OF RECEIPT BY THE NUMBER OF SHARES DONATED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION UPDATED ITS ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION TO REFLECT ITS NAME CHANGE FROM INDIAN HILL MUSIC, INC. TO GROTON HILL MUSIC, INC.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A DRAFT OF THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO DISTRIBUTION TO THE FULL BOARD. ONCE THE AUDIT COMMITTEE FINDS THE DOCUMENT TO BE ACCEPTABLE, THE FULL BOARD RECEIVES A COPY TO REVIEW. ALL BOARD MEMBERS ARE GIVEN AN OPPORTUNITY TO ASK QUESTIONS, AND ONCE THOSE QUESTIONS AND ANY RESULTING REVISIONS ARE ADDRESSED, THE 990 IS FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAINTAINS A FORMAL, WRITTEN CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. EACH MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND THE OFFICERS OF THE ORGANIZATION ARE REQUIRED TO CERTIFY ON AN ANNUAL BASIS THAT THEY HAVE RECEIVED AND REVIEWED THE POLICY AND THAT THEY ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH IT. INTERNAL EMPLOYEES TRACK TO ENSURE CERTIFICATIONS ARE RECEIVED AND THAT NO ISSUES ARE REPORTED. IF CONFLICT(S), OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT(S), OF INTEREST EXIST, THEY WOULD BE BROUGHT TO THE ATTENTION OF THE CHAIR OF THE BOARD AND CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER FOR FURTHER REVIEW AND RESOLUTION. ANY CONFLICT OF INTEREST WOULD BE RECORDED IN THE MINUTES OF THE BOARD AND WHERE THE CONFLICT(S) CONCERN(S) ANY BOARD MEMBER(S), THE INDIVIDUAL(S) SHALL NOT PARTICIPATE IN ANY VOTE OR DELIBERATION OF THE MATTER. IF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST SEVERELY IMPEDES AN INDIVIDUAL'S ABILITY TO PERFORM THEIR ORGANIZATIONAL DUTIES, THAT INDIVIDUAL WILL BE REMOVED FROM THEIR POSITION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INCREASES TO CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER'S COMPENSATION INCLUDE A PERFORMANCE REVIEW PROCESS, A REVIEW OF COMPARABILITY DATA, AND APPROVAL BY THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS OR A SUBSET THEREOF. MINUTES OF ALL MEETINGS RELATED TO THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER'S COMPENSATION ARE MAINTAINED TO DOCUMENT THE DELIBERATIONS AND DECISIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST. THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE STATES THIS AND ALSO PROVIDES THE CONTACT INFORMATION TO OBTAIN THESE DOCUMENTS.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF CHARITABLE GIFT ANNUITIES -21,603.
THE ORGANIZATION HAS AN AUDIT COMMITTEE THAT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE OVERSIGHT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND THE SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT. THIS PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED DURING THE YEAR.
